alert.note: Alert for Wicomico; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:14AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Maryland, including the following counties, Wicomico and Worcester. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Berlin, Snow Hill, Newark, Ocean Pines, Cape Isle Of Wight, Pittsville, Willards, Ironshire, Cedartown, Whiton, Powellville, Whaleyville, Showell, Mount Wesley, Public Landing, Bishop, Bishopville, West Ocean City, Boxiron and Girdletree. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
